Reviews.Title: “Paradise in a small package”
Reviews.Author: LSUtiger1974
Reviews.Content: I travel internationally on business, but took a romantic break with my wife. This hotel was booked on a chance, and I was pleasantly surprised. It is a diamond in the rough. Rooms were comfortable, location was great, restaurant was wonderful and the staff was very accommodating. Every request was granted and Pascal at the bar was just a true professional. His restaurant suggestions were spot on, and he never forgot my evening glass of red. I will return here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Amanda G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short break at the beginning of March. The staff were all really friendly and welcoming from reception through bar to breakfast. Talking of breakfast, there was a good selection of continental breakfast items, fruit, eggs and smoked sausage, and two lovely tarts - not great on the figure but a delicious treat for a holiday breakfast. I like the fact that it was fairly small - about 50 rooms I think - and a little bit individual rather than the large generic chain hotels where feel you could be staying anywhere. The bar/breakfast area n funky colours with comfy chairs - the secluded courtyard to the rear looked like it would be a tranquil spot for a quiet drink when the weather is slightly warmer. The room we had was clean and spacious (junior suite), with a really comfortable king sized bed. The loo was separate from the bathroom (nice touch) which had an amazing power shower that blasted us awake in the morning and a lovely deep bath The location was great for us - 5 or 10 mins from the Tour Eiffel and the Seine - up which we took a lovely cruise (just right on a rainy afternoon), about 15 mins from the Arc de Triomphe / Champs Elysee. We also walked to and from the Louvre and Pompidou Centre - a bit further a field but on a lovely sunny day and surrounded by the fabulous architecture, what's not to like? The Lee's, UK

Reviews.Title: “not a four star, 3 max”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty D
Reviews.Content: I booked this via Last minute.com, after carefull consideration i selected this hotel mainly because the reviews were average and the website had this down as "higly reccommded", the last time i visited Paris was 10 years ago so i didnt have much idea on best locations etc, so i selected thsi because of location near Eifell tower and Arc de triompe. my heart sank when we arrived as the hotel is off a tiny main road, tucked behind main buildings. I requested a special room as i had booked the trip as a suprise for our ten wedding anniversary and my husbands 40th Birthday, we were given no special treatment with regards to rooms, our room looked over the parking area and faced the rear of the buildings on main road, they are inneed of a refurb. the reception area is nice however the furniture is in need of a replacing. the hallways to the rooms are massivly in need of redecortaing, they have been done poorly with paint marks on the wall paper, as my heart had already sank due to the look on my hubbys face when he seen the outside of the htel it sank even more when the lift opened to reveal the shapby ness of hallways, howeevr i was pleasently suprised when we opened our room, it was very clean, it had a desk with chair, two tubb chairs with a reading table and aking size bed, the laundry and towells were changed daily which is always a bonus. there is a mini bar whcih is well over priced (small bottle of evian 4 euros!) the negative was there is no tea and coffee facitlies, (which the hotel describtion says it has, along with bath robes which we didnt have) the charged 24euros for a continental breakfast which we didnt opt for as far too expensive i did though borrow two teacups and there hot water to make a cup of tea each morning (we had our own milk teabags and sugar in the room) for this they charged me on departure 20 euros plus tax! i was disgusted that we could have a steak meal acroos the road for 18 euros and they could charge 24 euros for a cups and hot water! they also do not carter for english people with regrads to the TV, you may think this trivia as Paris is the city of love but realistically when you spend the entire day site seeing when you do come back to your hotel room after a shower you sit a and watch a little tv, to have the news (bbc and sky) on a loop is depresing to say the least! the bathroom was great, shower powrful and Bath deep so you could recoup after being on your feet all day. The hotel staff were very nice and pleasent there is a Carrefour located 1 min away so you can but water and snacks there, its open from 7am till 11.0pm there is also a lovely Sushi bar opposite a nice pub/bar on the main road called Kleber Pub, nice steak and chips but the waiters are great, they also have "happy hour" from 5-7pm in all the two nights stay cost me £340, do i think its value for money? No ..would i stay hear again? propably Not..would I reccommend it? depends, if you wanted a no frills then yes, if you wnated a hotel to to give you that little bit more or to be better located then no, i would recommend you choose a hotel closer to the Louvre as the majority of sites and buildings are located at the bottom of the champs de Elysee.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable smaller hotel in a near perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Denis B
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Garden Elysee online for a long weekend birthday treat for a special friend. The fabulous Moulin Rouge was a reasonable cab ride away and the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysee, Arc de Triomphe, Lido, Bateaux Parisiens and Trocadero were all within walking distance. The Hotel was very comfortable and the highlight was undoubtedly the legendary barman Pascal. Pascal has worked there for over 23 years and is a master cocktail maker who speaks several languages and he couldn't have been more helpful or charming. All in all it was a very special and very enjoyable break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, great location, reasonably priced, friendly team...”
Reviews.Author: Nosheel
Reviews.Content: I booked for a post Christmas surprise birthday trip. The location teamed with reasonable price tag (Paris isn't infamous for being kind to the pocket) and good reviews sold it. It was easy to get to from CDG via train and metro (The RER B, blue line from CDG to Chatelet Les Halles, then change to RER A, red line to CGD Etoile, then change to metro line 6, green to Boisierre, then a few mins away - sounds more difficult than it is). The team were helpful, friendly and spoke excellent English, though I always try my best to say the basics in any native language, albeit dreadfully! A restaurant minutes away was recommended for dinner on my request and it was excellent; 'Jammin' it's called. Seemingly full of locals too, which is what I prefer. The hotel bedroom was clean, fairly spacious and had everything anyone needs for a couple of days. The bar/restaurant area looked nice enough but we unfortunately didn't try either; when in Paris... There's apparently a gym area etc too, but of little interest to us! Location wise it really is about 5-10 mins (depending on footwork) to the Eiffel Tower/Trocadero area, and the same distance in the opposite direction to The Arc de Triomphe/Champs Elysee, and the immediate area has a fair few bars and cafes if in urgent need to eat or drink. Overall a nice little place where I would definitely stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and 7 min walk to The Eiffel Tower- La dame de fer”
Reviews.Author: CoastalGroove
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 min walk to subway and 7 min walk to The Eiffel Tower, great neighbourhood resturants and bars and very quiet. The hotel was nice for the price and enjoyed its tucked away garden feel. We were able to go to the Eiffel Tower at sunrise and in the evenings as it was right in our neigbourhood!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luther67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Garden Elysee with my sexy wife for one night in October. It's a nice hotel in a quiet courtyard. The hotel room was clean and nicely decorated, with a cool bathroom with a powerful shower and bath. Nice flatscreen TV with good choice of channels, showing the English football results! Location was good, just across the road from a metro station and only 10 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower. There's a supermarket next door, a sushi restaurant opposite and bars and pubs just around the corner. Staff were also helpful and courteous. All in all, this was a good hotel, in a handy location. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the star rating, look at the price.”
Reviews.Author: snowman40
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the 4 start Garden Elysee for two nights on business. The hotel is in a quiet road near Trocadero and the Champs Elysee (well, near is relative, but walkable) and lies back off the road and so is even quieter. The entrance and lobby/bar area are promising and I found all the reception staff friendly generally. Sadly, the room I stayed in, on the 5th floor, wasn't 4 star in my view. It was, it must be said, roomy and very clean, but the decoration was tatty, there were chips in the bath and the shower head was jammed on one setting (it worked, so I didn't bother complaining). TV reception was poor (this seems to be a common problem in Parisian hotels, though) and the complimentary toiletries weren't high quality. There was free wifi (in this age all 3 star and above hotels should offer this, I believe) which is always a bonus. I didn't eat here, so can't comment on the quality of the food, but I ate a very good meal in the Restaurant St Didier (a very unpromising looking place a few metres up the road from the hotel) one night. If you are expecting 4 star standard, I think you will be disappointed in the Garden Elysee, but if you look at the price it's more in line with 3 star hotels in Paris and at that standard it's roomier and cleaner than a number I've stayed in. Go in with the right expectations and you'll probably be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “2 Great Nights.”
Reviews.Author: deco21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, very clean and very well positioned, walkin distance to the eiffel tower,arch d triumph and the champs elysees. There is a metro station across the road which was fantastic. The area of Paris is very expensive, somthing which we were not expecting, so be warned!! 10 euro for two coffee's in the hotel bar, very expensive by anybody's standards, otherwise well worth a stay, sadly air france let it all down at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalgo
Reviews.Content: My room at this hotel was clean and pleasant, though the room of one of my colleagues was small and poorly decorated. Breakfast was fine and staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not really living up to its star rating”
Reviews.Author: kbradburn
Reviews.Content: It looked lovely on the website so we booked a suite as a treat! VERY expensive at over 500 euros a night. The room was just a normal double really, the shower door didnt close properly so we flooded the bathroom every time we used it. The room service menu was covered in sticky chocolate finger marks and the view was of a wall. The gym was closed for our visit due to a leak, considering this was a factor in booking we were dissapointed and the wifi was not working! All this for a 4 star hotel?? On the plus side you cant fault the location and the staff were friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: Julianne R
Reviews.Content: What a fab find. Set back from the hustle and bustle of the main streets of Paris, this little gem scored top marks on every level. The room was a good size and exceptionally clean. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and we were met with a big smile when we arrived. We didn't eat there so I can't comment on the food and we didn't use all the facilities, however everything we did use was very good. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Ed C
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent. Staff were all polite, courteous and very informative. Location is wonderful for walking to major sights or catching the metro. Enjoyed my stay very much and can't wait to go back and would consider staying at the same hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for visiting major tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: Stavkkon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at the beginning of August 2011, when my husband and I visited Paris for 3 days. It is located on a quiet street off Kepler Avenue, which makes it ideal for visiting Trocadero, the Eiffel Tower, and the Arch of Triumph. It is also very close to a metro station, which, for us, made commuting very easy. The hotel has an internal front yard/parking and a secluded garden, both of which add to the impression that you are off the bitten track. To be absolutely honest, based on the pictures on the hotel website, I expected the garden to be a bit bigger. However, it was the ambiance that mattered. We stayed at a room on the third floor. The furniture were neatly arranged and the bathroom was clean, but there was nothing extravagant about either. There is a minibar with a wide spread of snacks and drinks, though--as expected--with an extra charge. The hotel staff was particularly polite and eager to help with every question we had. They offered suggestions for sights to view and arranged for taxis to pick us up whenever asked. There were also tickets to tours at the reception. Even if we preferred not to buy from there, as we didn't want to restrict ourselves to a schedule, I found it very convenient for someone who doesn't really want to plan far ahead but would like some structure in their vacation. What I enjoyed least from the hotel was the breakfast, which comes with an extra charge of 22 Euros per person per day. My husband and I got the breakfast one of the three mornings we were there, but were a bit disappointed both by the variety and the quality of the food. Indeed, there were some bread to toast, croissants, a few kinds of cheese, cereals, ham, jam, juice, and fruit, but not the spread expected from a 4-star hotel. There was nothing cooked on demand (e.g., omelette, scrambled eggs, or crepes), which would have made a big difference. The juice was squeezed some hours earlier--or so it felt--given that it didn't taste too fresh. And the most annoying to the eye were the grapefruit halves, which must have been cut the night before, as they were really dry. Apart from the breakfast, I would go back to this hotel for its location and sense of privacy, even though there was nothing extravagant about it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little gem”
Reviews.Author: eamorgan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our anniversary trip and it was worth it! The hotel is lovely; modern/contemporary decor in the public and private areas. The room was large by European standards (somehwat small by American standards, however, the bathroom was spacious for a hotel by any standard. The location was perfect--right in between the Effiel Tower and the Champs Elyees-both within walking distance. Everyone is correct about Pascal--he is great. While I had the best cocktails on the patio, they were pricey. If you just want wine, go to the corner store and pick up a bottle. The breakfast was very good and the daily papers kept me in touch with what was going on in the world. The staff were very accomodating and even put up with my one semester of French. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit: and most certainly not our last!”
Reviews.Author: HE-Bailiff
Reviews.Content: Rooms in Paris hotels are notoriously small (many Transatlantic trippers often fail to grasp this fact: and that ice machines are in short supply in Europe!): not so room 27 at the Garden Elysee. A decent size by Parisian standards, it also benefits from backing on to the hotel's quiet rear garden and having large picture windows. As for the hotel generally, it is perfectly located for getting about. A short walk from the Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Triomphe and the Metro, it's also just a few steps away from a great supermarket: ideal for topping up on mineral water and other essentials! Pascal manages the bar and as well as pouring his trademark Gin Tonic Exotique, he can get you in to all sorts of great eateries. This time he even ran over the road to get us a great sushi meal late one evening when the restaurant was closed! The hotel is a family-run affair and very welcoming: there is no Gallic shrugging; everyone speaks English; and, if you try a little French you'll be made to feel even more at home. H.E. Bailiff Alastair Y. Redpath-Stevens GCSJ

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Pedro
Reviews.Content: We went to our honeymoon in Paris and stayed in the charming Hotel Garden Elysee, the hotel and the staff were wonderful, the hotel is beautiful and the staff was just perfect! They were very attentive, nice and learned some words in Portuguese to talk to us, and treated us with great affection. We stayed in a standard suite and it was great, the room had a lot of space, nice bathroom and a wardrobe, the bed was divine, the room is much bigger than many others that we knew in Paris, delicious breakfast, charming hotel, beautiful location with nice decoration and pretty gardens, right near the subway and bakeries, restaurants, the beautiful Champs Elysees and the Eiffel tower, but in a quiet street, being in middle of the best of Paris and even so been able to have a good night's rest. We recommend this hotel, you will not regret it! We would certainly come back again!

Reviews.Title: “flying visit”
Reviews.Author: gazfarr
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located (kind of) smack bang in the middle of Paris; well it wasn't far at all for me, from my office, 5 mins to the Tour Eiffel and Arc de triomphe. Right by a metro station and with a handy number of bars / cafes around. Entrance to hotel is very nice as is the reception area and the staff were very friendly - one chap had lived not far from my home in the UK so we chatted about that - the little things make a difference. Room was on the large side, very clean and modern. My only complaint of the room is that whilst there was no ironing facilities in the room itself, I couldn't see an information pamphlet explaining whether there were ironing rooms, or if this was available from reception. Seriously.... if this is the only thing bad I can find about the hotel then that must say something. For business purposes I would recommend this hotel every time for it's location and comfortable relaxed but upmarket atmosphere, but if i was in Paris other than for work I might try and find somewhere a bit close to the action. Horses for courses though

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value in great location”
Reviews.Author: Nicol111
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in March having booked 2 superior rooms. the bedrooms were roomy and spotlessly clean. All the staff were exceptionally pleasant and welcoming and the reception staff cheerfully fended guests's endless questions. No restaurant but an excellent buffet breakafst served, though not cheap. Plenty nice little cafes nearby for sa cheap breakfast or snack. Nearby restaurant recommendations by reception staff were good. The location is superb for visiting the city. Easy walking distance to Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tour and Champs d'Elysee. Tube and bus just a few hundred meters away. I highly recommend this hotel for its location, facilities, friendliness and value for money in its category and will certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Artlover2011 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for four nights, on a bed and breakfast basis. The reception staff were helpful, the rooms were quiet at night with no traffic noise. The breakfast buffet carried a good range of cereals, fruit, pastries, bread, cold meats, cheese, etc. There is a breakfast room but no restaurant. The hotel has a room service menu. The hotel is located about 3 kilometres by foot from the Louvre; but the Metro is only about 500 metres away. There is a useful supermarket within 100 metres. A good hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in handy location”
Reviews.Author: jackarooney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 40th birthday weekend. The location is handy for metro and is five minutes walk from the major open top bus tour stop. Ten minutes walk in either direction brings you to Arc de Triumphe or Eiffel tower. There are plenty of little cafes and restaurants along the side streets ranging in price. We would recommend restaurant "Jamin" which is a 5 minute walk away. The hotel was quiet and the staff extremely helpful. The room was adequately sized and had all facilities except coffee making stuff. All in all a great hotel for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended, we will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: katoussa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for my dad's 60th birthday weekend and really had the perfect weekend. We want to sincerely thank the lovely barman (evening of Sat 30th April) as when we asked about ordering a bottle of champagne for our dad, he was so enthusiastic about our birthday celebration he set up a private area for us with snacks and the champagne beautifully displayed then called dad down himself so we could then wait in the area surprise him with his gifts and do a proper presentation, we were very touched by his kindness and effort. We found the location of the hotel to be excellent and enjoyed watching the eiffel tour sparkle at night as it is only a short 10 minute walk away. The reception staff were always polite, friendly and helpful and the rooms were kept beautifully clean. It was just lovely to come back to this haven of peace after a busy day in the city and we all slept wonderfully. It really was the perfect choice, we cannot recommend it highly enough and would be delighted to return for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: georgiatraveler5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Paris as part of our 20th anniversary trip. We chose this hotel because of it's location and it had good reviews. It was better than we expected. The beds were very comfortable, it had free wifi, they even came in and provided a little turn down service. The breakfast was included and it was very good. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. It was quiet yet there were restaurants and a grocery store nearby. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as described. An oasis in this lovely part of Paris. Will”
Reviews.Author: LAZZZZ
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is as described, quiet, comfortable and spacious for a Parisien hotel. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: LuisA1981
Reviews.Content: We went to stay there for a weekend and the guy at reception was the rudest person you could imagine, he even called one of my friends stupid for not realising that the double bed was two single beds put together. The hotel is very clean and the beds comfortable, but a bit overpriced, specially the bar who charged 18 Euro for a rum and coke!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: travel189951
Reviews.Content: The service in the hotel was very nice, good suggestions about seeing Paris, reception extra friendly! Room was facing inner yard - no traffic noice! If I go to Paris again, I choose the same hotel ( very good location close to Eiffel etc ) Antti & Margot

Reviews.Title: “Lovely oasis in the heart of Paris, would recommend anyone to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Red2549
Reviews.Content: Not the biggest rooms but better than many we've stayed in in a Capital city. For those who like to have a hot drink in your room take a travel kettle as, in line with virtually all French hotels, there are no tea/coffee making facilities. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the bed and room very comfortable. The hotel is extremely close to 2 metro stations and a stone's throw from the Arc de Triomphe or in the other direction the Eiffel Tower. Lots of great places to eat wihin a short distance. We would make a point of staying here whenever we go back to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Im shocked about the good reviews?!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBrit21
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks lovely from the outside.... hideous on the inside. The paint work was awful and dirty. The shower (which is usually situated above your head was non existant (had a pipe with no shower head) and instead was at the open end of the bath half way down. And no it wasnt adaptable to go on the on above your head? There were no tea and coffee facilities, a cup of tea from the bar was 6 Euros... that is one expensive cup of tea I'd say. Other than a scripted welcome the staff were not very friendly atall.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - Elegant - good service”
Reviews.Author: GiorgioNapoli
Reviews.Content: Went to htis hotel right after staying at the Best western Marais Bastille. It was just slightly pricey than the first one, but totally another level. Very good quality, good position, good spacious room, kind and effective reception. Very good position near Arc de Triomphe. I would go there again for sure. I took a Junior suite, but it was just as big as a normal hotel room, although of good quality. Bed was confortable and big enough for two.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kristakiyoko
Reviews.Content: I had a week long medical conference to attend in Paris and found a great deal at the Garden Elysee. The conference offered good rates at the Meridien and Concorde Lafayette which are both large luxury hotels, but I wanted a more "boutique" experience while in Paris. I found a great deal on hotwire, so the price couldn't be beat. The Hotel: While is may not look like much from the front (it's sort of hidden down a short alley/side street), the lobby is very clean and modern. There isn't much in the way of amenities here, but if you're in Paris you shouldn't be working out or sitting in a hotel lobby! The Rooms: They are small, but spacious in comparison to other rooms in Europe. It's just not fair to compare the size of these rooms to the overs-sized/all suite places we see in the states. The Location: When you are in Paris, you are expected to walk (probably why the women are so thin there). That being said, I was in heels the whole time and never had a problem getting around. Also, for the fashonista, it's incredibly close to the Champs-Elysee (where I splurged on Chanel purse). Also, the public transit system in Paris is phenomenal so it was not a problem to get to all the major tourist spots. The Staff: Fabulous. I did not encounter any Parisian snootiness as some have warned me about (my fiance's family is from England so they may be slightly biased). They were incredibly accommodating and friendly. I am a young (very young) single female traveler and they treated me with the utmost courtesy. Extras: They have an elevator, which is great for any boutique-ish hotel. Also, everyone speaks English...which is the case in most of Europe anyway but one less worry. Overall: Fabulous hotel and value. Great for someone who frequents luxury hotels, but wants to try something low-key with the same level of service and cleanliness that you expect from 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: AnnieLinton
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in an excellent location. Spent a lot of time exploring Paris on foot - which was made possible by the hotel being so central. Delicious breakfast buffet, and extremely courteous and helpful staff both at the bar/buffet area and at the front desk. They always explained anything we wanted to know and their English was first class. The room & ensuite were lovely - as other reviews have mentioned it was slightly on the small size, but that really didn't matter as you don't spend much time in them. Bed was also exceedingly comfortable! Truly great stay - thank you everyone at the Garden Elysee for such a memorable weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially just for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: bettydavis3101
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel when we visited Paris for a weekend break. Although the rooms are quite small we didnt find this much of a problem as we were out sightseeing most of the time. The service in the hotel was great and the rooms were clean. Would have been handy to have had tea and coffee making facilities but it wasn't too much of a problem for us. The rooms offered free wifi which is great. The location is ideal. Walking distance to the Eiffel tower and the arc de triomphe and seconds away from a metro station. All in all a great location and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting evening”
Reviews.Author: PaulfSharp
Reviews.Content: after 13 hours working happy to return to hotel, too late to eat but evening spent at bar socially rewarding. Meet Pascal Barman, Consierge and generl friendly and attuative gentleman. Pascal can inform you where might be open and whats good also whats 2 for 1. Hotel hosts 4 *, not exactly 4* rooms I had superior on the corner of 2nd floor, woken by bath running in room next door, apart from that clean, courteous and so far efficient.Will be back for lesure stay shortly hope to be warmly welcomed and sure i will be. Paul

Reviews.Title: “The Garden Elysee was a beautiful hotel with great service and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca2727
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Paris at the Garden Elysee! Though the rooms were a bit small (to be expected), the hotel made up for it with great service and staff that went above and beyond even during the holidays! We especially liked chatting with Jerome at the front desk who would always have wonderful recommendations about things to do and eat nearby the hotel! It was a little far from the center of Paris but there was a convenient metro stop a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendus Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ravegirl9
Reviews.Content: Horrendus Hotel - Not in a good location. Horrible and rude staff. I am a single woman traveller and a man walked into the room when I was in the bathroom and the bathroom door was open bc there are no vents and it gets too steamy.. I got no apologies and at no point did anyone ask me if I had a satisfying stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mervina
Reviews.Content: Well, I was whisked on a surprise weekend to Paris for my 30th birthday... And then my OH proposed on day after my birthday in this very hotel, so it has incredibly special memories for us! Can't comment on VFM as I don't know how much it cost, but the room was lovely. We had a very comfortable bed and space for a little table and chairs with ample wardrobe space. The bathroom was also of a good size, with a powerful shower. One of the best things about the room, and indeed the location of the hotel in general, was it was so very quiet; I am a really light sleeper but had a great night's sleep here. Additionally, the reception staff were welcoming and helpful. Also willing to speak French! We didn't use the bar or have breakfast in the hotel, preferring to make use of the cafes/small shops in the surrounding streets. Avenue Kleiber had lots of choice. We have a tradition of getting takeaway pizza on birthday nights and Speed Rabbit was delicious! We also ate at the Italian restaurant next door to the hotel, which was OK but on reflection would have been better off venturing to a more French bistro on Avenue Kleiber. You are only 10 mins away from the Trocadero Gardens and the Eifell Tower - the moment the tower came into view as we strolled down the road was magical!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Value, Don't Miss Pasquale's Martini”
Reviews.Author: frs90088
Reviews.Content: Just spent 7 delightful nights with the Hotel. The staff was always anxious to provide suggestions as to where to visit or eat. Pasquale was delightful and entertaining. The front desk staff was accommodating even when I asked questions which would have tried the most patient staff. The rooms were well maintained and definitely in keeping with the better hotels. Location of the Hotel is ideal to main attractions and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Struck Gold”
Reviews.Author: ColinG0VAR
Reviews.Content: Had a short (3 night) break here and were really pleased with the overall experience. The room, although smallish by normal 4 star standards, was VERY clean, each time we returned to the room after the maids had been in, you felt like you were the first person to use the room. The only complaint about the room was the lack of kettle for the usual tea/coffee etc, however, we new about this before we got there and took a small travel kettle, tea and coffee and the mini-bar kept the milk cold... (there is a mini market just a few yards from the hotel). All of the staff were friendly and efficient, but special thanks go to Pasqual, the bar manager, he was friendly and helpful and not only gave great advice on places to visit and eat, but also made reservations and bookings and arranged taxi's, thanks Pasqual.. We only had breakfast once in the hotel, this was pricey by comparison to the many restaurants in easy walking distance and also limited in the choices available. With the entrance to the hotel being through a private courtyard off a quite road, there was next to no noise from outside, even with the windows open. All in all, a very good experience and we would have no trouble recommending this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Garth59
Reviews.Content: Very nice, no extractor in room so room filed with steam. Havent stayed in Paris before but this was a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, large rrom and bathroom, terrific locaton”
Reviews.Author: dianeursilo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is superior for small European hotel and in wonderful neighborhood tucked away form all the noise but a few blocks form metro and open tour bus stops, 10 miinute walk to eiffell tour and 15-20 minute walk to Arch of Triumph. Friendly and helpful staff with great breakfast if incuded in your room package. Our room was bright and large deep bath tub with good size closet and queen bed. Modern decor but very nice with lovely courtyard. Major artery on Kelber Street has nice cafes and great bistro on the corner and across the street- Pub Kleber. Estensive variety of food, good qualaity and reasonably priced. Also fine restaurant within short walk- Jamin. Hotel will make reservations for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, all OK but not amazing...”
Reviews.Author: J-Wo-2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be close to the Eiffel Tower and it's location is fantastic. It is lovely to be tucked away so conveniently. We only stayed for one night and it was comfortable and pleasant. Our second night we moved to a small boutique hotel in near Notre Dame and for the same price got heaps more character. Staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, clean and lovely for sight seeing.”
Reviews.Author: supergran7
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for my Golden Wedding, and found hotel Garden Elysee just what we wanted, near to everything. We flew to Charles De Gaulle airport and we were a little apprehensive about getting to our hotel, we shouldnt have worried it was a doddle. Weather was kind to us and I can really recommend this hotel. Breakfast abit expensive but if you have a good appetite everything you could wish for.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay in a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lledbetter
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Garden Elysee during our trip to Paris this fall. It's a lovely boutique hotel tucked away from all the noisy and busy streets. It is also conveniently located half way between the Arc de Triomphe and Tour Eiffel (a half mile away from each). It is a bit far from the other major sights but there are various metro stations within short walking distance so it is not difficult to arrive at other locations in a short amount of time. While most, if not all, Paris hotel rooms tend to be small, we found the size to be adequate. We didn't mind the cozy size of the room since we didn't spend a lot of time there, but since sleep is important to us, we were extremely pleased with the comfort of the bed and pillows! The hotel staff was professional, polite and friendly. They were very helpful with directions and other questions. There is also a nice little supermarket on the street corner which we found very convenient. If you wish to stay in a more peaceful area (away from the tourists) then we recommend the Garden Elysee!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in central yet peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: London055
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I found the hotel to be ideally located for our short shopping/sight seeing trip. The free wi-fi delighted my daughter, and our room and bathroom were clean and tidy. It was very peaceful at night, and we felt safe. The reception staff were helpful but not intrusive, and stored our bags until late evening on our final day. The hotel is close to the metro, and we were able to take in all the sights and shops that we could manage; I would recommend a visit to Angelina's tea salon on the Rue de Rivoli. The patisseries and surroundings were beautiful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly located hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: TravellingIFA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in August. Arrived at Gare du Nord early Friday morning and promptly bought the usual 3 day Paris Visite card for unlimited metro travel. Two changes and you're at Boissiere station within 30minutes. The hotel is a 5min walk from this metro station and we thought we'd drop our case off ready for a days sightseeing. Too our delight the room was ready (before 12) so we were able to unpack and freshen up. The receptionist was really really helpful and spent time going through a map of where to go etc. The room was great and not as small as some hotels in Paris. Mini bar, tv (BBC world news only!) and free Wifi which is very handy. Rooms were very clean and so incredibly quiet for central Paris. A 5 min stroll in the other direction and you're at the Trocadero and the wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower from the Palais de Chaillot. I was really impressed with this hotel, and ,having been to Paris a dozen times, I would return here without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: JustaGirlinAR
Reviews.Content: A wonderful little hotel very close (within walking distance - and we're not terribly athletic) to the Trocadero area, Effiel Tower. This was our first trip to Europe and we weren't sure what to expect, except small rooms. And while, the rooms were small they were big enough for us and very comfortable. Besides, we were in Paris!! We weren't spending a lot of time in the room. Everyone spoke english and the contential breakfast was wonderful. They always had Nutella and one morning they even had a chocolate torte! I endulged myself, afterall - I was in Paris!!! There is also a very nice little grocery store just a couple of doors down when the items from the wetbar start to add up. A wonderful experience and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and really quiet”
Reviews.Author: lfhw
Reviews.Content: I was really concerned with finding a hotel that'd be quiet, bearing in mind we wanted to stay in the centre of Paris - this was perfect as it was off Avenue Kleber (one of the big roads going off the Arc du Triomphe towards the Trocadero) and also set back from the road so there was little to no outside noise. We didn't hear anything from other guests or staff inside the hotel so my fears proved unfounded. It is in an excellent location, easy to walk to both the Arc du Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower, and there is a metro stop (Boissieres) about 2 minutes away. Hotel room was easily big enough for two, well-decorated and always cleaned. We had a lovely trip and I would book here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: H0lly_Days
Reviews.Content: Booked as a surprise birthday treat for my husband. For location this is a great little hotel tucked down a side street off Kleber Avenue close to the Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysee about a 10 min walk to either. Boissiere metro station is just 2 mins walk around the corner from the hotel. Also because of the location of the hotel there was very little traffic noise which was a welcome relief for a city break. Check-in to the hotel was smooth (but see below*) and the public areas of the hotel were very clean. I'd booked a superior room directly with the hotel. For a superior room, it was a bit on the small side and we had expected a walk-in shower, so was disappointed to find only a shower over the bath but nevertheless it was adequate and clean. *I was rather concerned when the hotel emailed me the day prior to arrival advising that my credit card used to book the hotel was not valid despite them charging the booking fee without problem to it some months earlier and if I didn't contact them our room would be released. Thankfully I'd checked my emails in time to sort the matter, although still do not know what the problem was with my credit card! We stayed on a room only basis so cannot comment on the meals and took breakfast at one of the many pavement cafe's close-by. Drinks in the hotel were very expensive which you can expect in a city, however 42 euro's for 1 bacardi and coke and 2 iced teas (non alcoholic) I thought was unreasonable. I would probably stay at this hotel again if only to guarantee a quiet stay but certainly wouldn't use the bar facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Claude333
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is perfect, near by Trocadéro and Champs Elysées with subway station at 2 mn walk. The hotel is clean, the rooms are neat and quiet as the hotel gives on a inside courtyard. Our room was on the back and a bit dark but as we were spending our days outside anyway, it really did not matter. Plus, the pigeons gave it an air of country side. And, anyway in Paris it is either that or a view on busy and noisy streets. The hotel accommodates a private parking which is always a safer way to park. Breakfast is really decent, quality of food and ingredients high - you can see they have been carefully picked and they never run out of anything as the waiters are making sure that each basket is always full. And this is much appreciated as it avoids the fighting over "eggs" with starving tourists! The service is the best I ever received in Paris - where I lived for a couple of years. From the reservation by phone, the receptionist, the waiters,the baggage helpers, the cleaning ladies and the management - they all have been extremely helpful, polite and eager to support us. It was a pleasure really. It is clearly management by teaming and mutual respect which makes the ambiance in the hotel very nice. My special thanks go to the Barman - Pascal - who was such a charm, so adorable and professional. He made me a marvelous cocktail and he selects his wines with care while telling you stories - France as we like it !!!!!! This week has been a delight and I am ready to go back at any time, so I can only recommend it as, as a French person, I also know how hard it is to find good hotels and immaculate service in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KeithnBetty
Reviews.Content: Loved the Garden Elysee Hotel! A quiet hotel in the heart of Paris within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. Located on a side street off the busy Avenue Kleber with a front courtyard giving it a nice "tucked away" feel. The rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Close access to the Metro as well. Will definitely stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harlister
Reviews.Content: Close to a metro stop and within a short walk to The Arc Du Triomph, this modern and comfortable Hotel is well located in a quiet side street. The staff were very warm and welcoming and the Hotel was spotlessly clean. Our room was comfortable (especially the beds) and a good size. However, there was a slight disturbance from the courtyard each morning at waste collection time, so try to suggest a room at the rear of the Hotel. The selection at the breakfast buffet was rather limited but the quality was good and very tasty. I would recommend this Hotel, we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Eiffel tower & Arc De triomphe”
Reviews.Author: JonnyQ66
Reviews.Content: Had a great 2 night (3 day) break in Paris. It was my first visit to Paris and wanted a hotel close to Eiffel tower, as I have always wanted to go up! This hotel was 10 minutes away and 10 minutes the other way Arc De Triomphe. We had the superior room which was only a little more and very nice, a decent size for Paris. As everyone knows Paris is expensive, just by hotel is a supermarket and round corner on Avenue Kleber we found a good priced cafe/bar Le Rallye Etoile (very friendly owners & staff, good priced drinks & meals - breakfast, lunch & dinner). The hotel is very quiet outside & in, perfect for our romantic few days away without the kids. If you plan on going up Eiffel tower this is extremely busy, highly recommend buying your tickets online before you travel, you then basically have a Fast Pass! Would recommend this hotel if you want Eiffel tower/Arc de Triomphe area. We visited Notre dame and we actually preferred that area. When we go back to Paris will stop in this area, it was a bit more authentic France, where Garden Elysee is has a lot of business/offices/commercial. But if you want to be near Eiffel tower, have a decent, nice room & nice hotel then you won't go wrong with the Garden Elysee.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: SydneyRousseau
Reviews.Content: difficult to believe the tenor of these reviews after my stay with colleagues. Ok so it is well located and relatively quiet. the staff are helpful and forthcoming with suggestions. but the decor is showing its age and the rooms are frayed and getting tatty. perhaps for this reason the place was full of workmen during my visit, which didn't add to the overall impression. frankly you can do better for this price in the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brilliant service and good location!”
Reviews.Author: NiffandRem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Garden Elysee for a long weekend in May 2010. We were pleased with the hotel's location (halfway between the Eiffel tower and Arc de Triomphe) with a 5 -10 minute walk to either. The room was a good size (double room) with a ensuite with shower above the bath. The bed was comfortable and the room very clean. The service was excellent - right through from check in to checking out. We pre-booked the hotel 2 months in advance so got a good rate (around £150 per night) so this is why we rated it good value (the 'rack rate' is very expensive at around 350 euro per night). The only niggles we would have were there was no light to see in the wardrobe (but it was a good size with plenty of hangers). We also ran out of toilet roll and tissues which weren't replaced (but we could have rung down). We also had a tea and hot chocolate in the lobby which was a little pricy at 10 euros (although cheaper than one of the local pubs which charged us 15 euros for a coke and Orangina! - Paris is expensive!). Breakfast in the hotel was also quite pricy at 16 and 22 euros (but we guess this is to be expected in a nice hotel). There is an excellent small sushi take away/sit in restaurant just across the road (Planet Sushi) which is reasonably priced and good quality ( you can get this on room service, but obviously more expensive than going in yourself). Overall we were very pleased with the accommodation and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 day holiday in Paris”
Reviews.Author: EnglandDeirdre
Reviews.Content: Our daughter came over to visit us in England and we took her to Paris as a surprise. We arrived at the Garden Elysee Hotel and thought how tranquil it was. Reception stafff were most helpful, friendly and polite as were all the other staff. We had most comfortable, clean and spacious rooms which were very quiet.. We chose to have breakfast in the room which was prompt and well supplied. There were plenty of cafes, restaurants nearby for evening meals and to buy rolls, etc. to take away. The hotel is situated near to the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower, and the Metro is about 100 metres away, however, we walked everywhere!!! Didn't want to miss anything. Would certainly recommend the hotel for a great stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have found a better location, place with the greatest attention!”
Reviews.Author: Valentine081501
Reviews.Content: This small 46 rooms hotel is the most perfect place for anyone traveling on business or pleasure. The hotel is located on the 16TH Arrondissement. Close to major shopping areas, the Eiffel Tower, Cafes, and within walking distance to bus and metro stations that will take you anywhere in the City of Lights. The staff of this Hotel is like family to me. They are not only courteous, but always remember your preferences, your name and treat you like you are at home. The rooms are beautifully maintained, it is also quiet, room service is available and weather permitting the terrace is a wonderful place to have a quiet cup of coffee or tea in the late afternoon. This place is like my home away from home and I recommend it to anyone who loves the City of Paris as much as I do and needs to stay in a Hotel where you will be treated like a welcomed guest and not just like any tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: greenyburger
Reviews.Content: Very quiet hotel close to the Eiffel Tower. Like most hotels in Paris the room was quite small but was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A very welcoming hotel, staff are superb and the facilities very good.”
Reviews.Author: JiddaWales
Reviews.Content: We three sisters met up in Paris for a coffee and croissant, one sister coming from Canada and the others from the UK. The hotel is in a great position, on a side street off Avenue Kleber, just a few minutes from the Arc de Triomphe and at the other end an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower. Rooms were large, especially for Paris, modern and very clean. We were there during the volcano ash drift and they were doing all they could accommodate guests who needed to stay longer. The staff are very pleasant, always anxious to help with any queries or reuests. A tip - a coffee and croissant are cheaper in the hotel than in surrounding cafes. Price for breakfasts are dear. There are plenty of boulangeries, chocolate shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. We went to Restaurant Nicholas, as recommended by staff and the food was excellent - do book in advance though as it is very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on Location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: louisa43
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the staff or the location. Rooms clean and quite spacious (we had the basic one). Don't breakfast at hotel but turn left onto Ave Kleber and lots of good places there. 10 mins stroll if that to Eiffel Tower, metro stop a 2 min stroll away. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverHamish
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent. We could walk to the Arc de Triomphe or Tower in 10 minutes and the area was upscale and safe. Very close to the Metro. The rooms were very large by Paris standards, and the rooms were well-appointed. The hotel was very quiet (we were on the garden side). The beds were very comfortable, the room was cleaned well each day. The hotel staff was very gracious and helpful. There is a wonderful grocery store a few doors away, great restaurants nearby, and of course great bakeries! We stayed here for our 10th anniversary and honestly have nothing but praise for the Garden Elysee. I'd be back there right now if I could and would absolutely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing stay one can have in Paris. Incredible Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Iviro
Reviews.Content: Simply incredible staff, service, cleanliness and location. Staff is readily available for anything you need, give excellent recommendations for restaurants. The location is also amazing, a stone throw's away from the Eifel Tower and decent pubs and clubs for nightlife. Overall amazing stay, would recommend to anyone looking for a great stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, terrible stuff (1 exception)”
Reviews.Author: HCABraz
Reviews.Content: Well, after having all the kind of problems with Paris hotels (two, to be exactly, and I told the histories in other contributions), I found this hotel. The hotel itself is very good. The room is clean and has a good size (specially for Europe standards), it´s hidden, quiet, good location and has a good breakfast. The only "if" is the service. Although there was one EXCELLENT person there, that just make us feel at home, the other stuff wasTERRIBLE. Unfortunately I don´t remember their names, but they were very rude sometimes (one of them, at the reception desk, looked at a friend of mine, that was dressing an Armani t-shirt and Calvin Klein white shoes, and asked him if he was sure he was going out dressed like he was. My friend said yes, and the recepcionist guy said: "don´t want me to paint your shoes in black for you?" and laugh. My friend almost didn´t believe what he was hearing... He just smiled and went out). The stuff of the hotel is, as well, clearly too desperate about money. They charged us 70 euros just to book the Moulin Rouge show. I would not care in paying that amount (even it´s being abusive), BUT what made me angry was that they LIED to me. They said it was just an advanced pay, and I´d pay just the difference concerning the tickets over there. What a lie... I had to pay the full price over there. Considering everything, I would recommend this hotel only in two situations: 1) if the daily rates are really above the average price of the 4 star hotels around or 2) if you know already everything in Paris and won´t need the stuff for anything at all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service. Amazing Location.”
Reviews.Author: dance2much
Reviews.Content: I took my mom to Paris for her first trip abroad and we stayed at the Garden Elysee. From the moment we stepped in the staff was so nice and did everything they could to make sure my mom and I had a great stay. The hotel is an easy walk to both the Arc d'Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. There is a grocery store right next door and plenty of restaurants on Avenue Kleber to fit the needs of any meal. I can say without a doubt that I will stay here when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TT2Wigan
Reviews.Content: We are two couples who had a wonderful time in Paris, the hotel was excellent. Our rooms were clean and quite spacious by French standards. The bathroom had adequate toiletries available (especially while we took hand luggage only), towels were clean and soft and were changed daily. Hairdryer was a bit naff but was adequate. Beds were changed daily. We did not have breakfast as we thought this was a bit expensive but after leaving the hotel, turning left and left again onto Kleber Avenue a little cafe had an inexpensive french breakfast (coffee/tea/juice and pastry for around 5 euros). All tourist sites were within walking distance, the RER system was inexpensive and accessable to everywhere if you did not want to walk any distance. Went on river ferry well worth the 9 euros. Beautiful city, excellent hotel, wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff - Very Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fyrishsunset
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Garden Elysee for 4 nights. Excellent central location. Receptionists, porters and housekeepers all very pleasant, efficient & helpful. Refreshing to find staff so willing to please especialluy as my partner & I speak very little French. A big "Well Done" to all the employess at the Garden Elysee.

Reviews.Title: “I have to share the wealth on this one.....”
Reviews.Author: nguarni
Reviews.Content: I simply hate to tell anyone about this hidden Parisian treasure. I don't want the price to go up, or not be available when we go back...and go back we will. They say "location, location, location" in the real estate trade. This gem is located about 1/10 of a mile from TWO metro stops, easy walking distance to the Champs Elysee, Arc De Triomphe, and Eiffel Tower. It's on a quiet side street - you'd never know you're so well placed - and offset from the street. It's quiet and intimate and charming. The staff was the best and helped us with whatever question we had. They made phone calls for us when language was a barrier and just made this an ideal home away from home. Room was spotless and certainly large enough for the two of us. By European standards, pretty good. If I had a suggestion for them: paint the hallway. It's simply not befitting of the rest of the hotel. Stay there...it's great.....

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the rip-off breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: rg6sys
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say that we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is tucked away off a very quiet street, within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel tower. The people on reception and behind the bar were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The only bone of contention, however, was the price of breakfast. I don't know if this is typically Parisienne but we found that 16-22 euros for orange juice, coffee and rolls was a bit 'over the top'.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, let itself down on small but important areas”
Reviews.Author: gerrymac32
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Arc De Triomphe and of course the excellent Metro system in Paris. on arrival the reception was very welcoming and helpful, assisting with our booking to the Moulin Rouge and advice on other areas (even as a previous visitor to Paris, I was impressed with the assistance). Room was comfortable enough for Paris and in a nice area. The biggest let down was for a Croissant, toast and an orange juice they charged €22, without the toast they said it would have been €16 - many handy brasserie close for less than half this for more. Finally the hotel should advice you to stop a taxi to go to the Airport - our taxi's meter was at €11 when it arrived due to the arrangements taxi's have. Other that it's a nice place - there are so many other hotels at this level in Paris they need to revise the small but important areas, as cost isn't the issue - but a little bit of commonsense is.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: HertsTraveller081
Reviews.Content: The Garden Elysee is in a great location in a quiet street but only 10-15 minutes walk from the Arc De Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower with a metro station nearby. The hotel has a welcoming feel and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were small but well-equipped and free internet access was available and we had no problems with connection during the stay. We stayed in the standard room and the bed was a bit short, if you're over 6ft (1.8m) tall, your feet will be dangling over the edge!!! These are minor quibbles though and don't detract from its' overall appeal. Some of the food and minibar was expensive (although Paris is generally expensive), but there is a local shop next door and plenty of relatively cheap cafes nearby. Overall a really good hotel that I would definitely return to.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Christy5802
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a whole week during our recent visit to Paris. It is a great location. Just far enough away to be quiet but so close and convenient, just a little walk to the Eiffel tower. It was about 2 blocks from the metro stop we used and within 2-3 blocks in either direction of several great cafe's, pattissieries, pharmacies, several quaint little shops including a charming and well priced jewelry store, and a tobaco shop near the trocadero. It's also right next door to a small grocery store and a sushi place. Amazing location. The staff were always very helpful, room service was good one night when we were too exhausted for anything else but of course we preferred to eat out and experience Paris cuisine. The grocery next door and Au Pain for sandwiches just around the corner made quick and inexpensive meals within easy reach. The breakfast buffet was nice, quiet, freshly squeezed juice and American Continental style, but again, with all the nice cafe's only 1-3 blocks away, we only ate there once when we were in a rush, although service was great. The rooms were always clean and everyone friendly and accomodating. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, very nice and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: youngatheart84
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel tucked away in a side street but within easy walking (15 minutes of the Arc de Triomp and, 10 minutes of the Trocadera with it's excellent views of the Tour Eiffel. Our room was very clean, comfortable and spacious. The staff were very warm and helpful. L'Opentour buses stop 5 minutes from the hotel and access to the metro is equally easy. There was a good selection of restaurants available locally. A very enjoyable short break - I would certainly look to return to this hotel it provided everything we were looking for; you would never know you were in the heart of the city once into the confines of the building/garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: citynomad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Garden Elysee for an impromtu weekend away. The hotel is in excellent reach of the Arc De Triomph, Champs Elysee and the Effel Tower, rooms were clean and comfortable with a view overlooking their own court yard. Facilities were great as well as the service from the hotel staff. Found we could walk to most attractions and also close to the major metro stations providing direct links to Le Marais, Bastille and Louve. Located just off Ave Kieber one off the main avenues off the Arc De Triomph, I found plenty of medium priced good quality restaurants and bars in the area, as well as several boutiques and stores on the Ave Victor Hugo which is close by. Perfect for a weekend away in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjtopbanana
Reviews.Content: The Garden Elysee was in the perfect place for us. We visited the Eiffel Tower on the way to it and strolled to the Arc de Triomphe once we'd unpacked. We had a wonderful restaurant (XVI) on the corner where we had a lovely meal. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and it all made our short stay extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Cold in paris”
Reviews.Author: bazza2004
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very warm and friendly, booked resturant for us they will also book taxis for you , didnt stay much in hotel, room was nice but did ask for double bed and got two singles . Paris overall was so cold but we were close to enough things to keep busy. nice resturants nearby so loads of food available. shop just round the corner to get snacks etc. They also let me extend check out time till 14:00 instead of 12.00 at no extra cost Overall a very nice relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Boomskilpaadjie
Reviews.Content: The Garden Elysee is a thoroughly gorgeous hotel. Situated just off the Trocadero and within easy access of the metro, the hotel was perfectly suited to our sight-seeing needs with lots of friendly restaurants nearby within walking distance and a view of the Eiffel Tower that sneaks up on you from nowhere! The staff at the hotel are beyond helpful. Nothing was too much trouble, from restaurant bookings to room choices and everything was done with a smile. The rooms themselves are clean, tidy and big enough for a short stay but lacking in certain basics like tea and coffee making facilities and a guest information pack. All in all, a lovely stay at the Garden Elysee.

Reviews.Title: “last nightmare in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rickny72
Reviews.Content: Imagine being in a room one night that was crawling with ants. The second night a flood in the bathroom with water running all night. The third night in a nice, but dirty room. After complaining to Travelocity for seven months I got a credit for a future trip for $100. The owners of the hotel even wrote a letter saying how unhappy we were, but would not give any credit. STAY AWAY, BE WARNED.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clivenorthernireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December 2008 to January 2nd 2009/ Staff at Reception both Helpful and pleasant. Room clean and size we had expeced. Best of all was the location close to all the sights we wanted to see. We did not eat breakfast in the Hotel as we wanted to experience all the cafes etc that we could. We dined out every evening and found lots of excellent restaurants. Hotel close to Metro also. We would stay at this Hotel again and the only reason we would'nt is we like to try different hotels. Drinks can be costly but as with the rest of our trip we were always out and about. We enjoyed the experience and recomment the hotel as a first visit to Paris. Anne & Clive - Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “A quiet but classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: MultiTripper
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Garden Elysee 10 years ago and loved it. Since then we have been to Paris 4 times and stayed in some very small roomed hotels. We wondered if the Elysees would be as good this time . As it was quite pricey , we skipped the 16euro breakfast and opted for a croissant and coffee in a snack bar near the metro stop - a few metres away - for a quarter of the price. The hotel was so nice and clean and all the staff very friendly and helpful. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room furnished nicely with plenty of hanging space for your clothes. The location is excellent too - an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower or the Champs Elysees. We won't return to Paris as we think it's now over rated and over priced but would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting.

Reviews.Title: “good but pricey”
Reviews.Author: AnotherOntarioguy
Reviews.Content: Was in town for business in June 2008. The location in the 16th was perfect and allowd me to walk to work as well as being close to enough restaurants and bars as well as tourist sights like the Eiffel Tower. If this was my first Paris hotel I would say the rooms are small. Having been to Paris a few times, this room was a cut above the others. Very quiet compared to other places I have stayed. No garbage trucks roaring by at 5:00 in the morning. My room backed on the courtyard which helped. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good and plentiful and included in my room rate. Speaking of rates, I paid 250 euros per night. Ouch. Translated to $400 on my credit card. Good place to stay, particularly if your employer is paying...

Reviews.Title: “Everything good”
Reviews.Author: Franklancs
Reviews.Content: Fantastic time...great location 2 mins from the Bossiere Metro stop. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, good English speakers with English newspapers in the lobby. Classy, small but well equipped rooms (could have done with another English channel on TV with the Olympics dominating, it does stick in your throat watching the French win medals, though thankfully not too often) Very quiet street, but with good cafe's nearby, the Chinese in particular were very good. Very very good and would thoroughly recommend Frank & Sue Power

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Le026
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, I was expecting a 4-star hotel service, but I was wrong. From the minute we arrived, the experience was very disappointing. The staff at the check-in desk was not very welcoming, not very helpful and even rude. The junior suite was of an acceptable size, but it was a major disappointment. It was very dark (even with all the lights on), with patches of damp and peeled painting on the entrance hall of the room. When I complained to the reception desk about the smell of damp the only answer that I received was 'open the window'. The deco was very dull and the carpets could do with some updating. The bathroom was OK. The room was overlooking the garden (more of a small patio than a garden), although the main view was an ugly internal massive wall. Compared to any 4-star hotel across Europe the facilities provided were well below the standard. Some positive points: the location; it's quiet, with hardly any traffic noice; breakfast was good.

HotelInfo.Name: Garden Elysee
HotelInfo.Address: 12, rue Saint Didier | 16th Arr., 75116 Paris, France
